alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Accomack and northern Northampton Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms near Onancock, or 9 miles north of Exmore, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Onancock and Onley around 1125 PM EDT. Parksley around 1140 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Hallwood, Harborton, Melfa, Mappsville, Jamesville, Silver Beach, Wachapreague, Wardtown, Accomac and Wallops Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.
